comment.body:
> [erkan](#comment_2_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf): Nice, how much time did this all take for you?

I made the first [prototype](https://yadi.sk/a/h2TbcquQkJdWm) in November, and ended only in late March. I had a very long wait of several parcels with the details. If our local mail worked faster, I would have made the joysticks much earlier. Anyway I have not so often a lot of free time.

[treegb](#comment_1_15dw2ne2hZ5wdTpg39HRq4TGiwDY3LaAH7),

I know about Krita, but I think it's more appropriate for digital painting than for photo processing. But if you think that Krita is capable of retouching photos too, then correct me and I'll try to learn Krita more. By the way, I'm using KDE, so I will have no problems with the installation :D

> Can you let me know how you do your website?

Blog.ZAlex.bit - [ZeroBlog](http://127.0.0.1:43110/blog.zeronetwork.bit), a simple CMS for ZeroNet, just press `Clone` button.
ZAlex.bit - [HTML5UP](http://html5up.net) static templates. Maybe you just didn't noticed the link in the footer.

> how you update your photo?

I'm just copied images to the site directory and added HTML links to them.

> [laithal](#comment_1_13F151XzapAUGX8U4HgYTsw7Jdb1P5mqHe): Awesome - and great article. Thanks for sharing.PS: How do you get the "Read More" button on the blog post?

```
Short description...

---

Long text here...
```

No, this is a standard "clone" and "heal" tools.
But thanks for the tip, I'll definitely try this plugin, it looks interesting.

> [sandrop](#comment_1_1Hg9eU6RHhx5nkQhr8zWzajzZcbrVEshic): neat, how much did you pay to get it? Sounds like a nice device to implement mesh nets on, albeit the speed limitations.

About [$13](https://ru.aliexpress.com/store/product/New-Orange-Pi-Zero-H2-Quad-Core-Open-source-512MB-development-board-beyond-Raspberry-Pi/1553371_32761500374.html?spm=a2g0v.12010612.0.0.30e25697AYJ8tX) with delivery (or $9 without).
Also, there is [cheaper model with 256 MB RAM](https://ru.aliexpress.com/item/New-Orange-Pi-Zero-H2-Quad-Core-Open-source-development-board-beyond-Raspberry-Pi/32760774493.html?spm=a2g0v.search0302.3.29.13efa8e2jEt5Z&ws_ab_test=searchweb0_0,searchweb201602_0_10152_10151_10609_51102_10594_10059_10312_10611_10314_10534_10313_10084_100031_10083_10107_10307_10604_10606_10605_10607_10341_10065_10142_10340_10068_10343_10541_10342_10125_10301_10345_10543_10103_10344-10344,searchweb201603_0,ppcSwitch_0&algo_pvid=9ba3cb4f-7c83-4f9f-8ccd-acf47c4cd3f1&algo_expid=9ba3cb4f-7c83-4f9f-8ccd-acf47c4cd3f1-3), $11 / $7. At the moment "home server" uses less than 100 megabytes of RAM from 512, and this is with running nginx, aria2 and ssh-server.
